item.title: Carraro India Ltd Upgraded to Buy on Improved Valuation and Financial Metrics
item.description: Carraro India Ltd, a key player in the Auto Components & Equipments sector, has seen its investment rating upgraded from Hold to Buy as of 30 December 2025. This upgrade reflects a marked improvement in the company’s valuation metrics, robust financial trends, and solid quality indicators, despite recent market underperformance. The revised Mojo Score now stands at 71.0, signalling increased investor confidence in the stock’s medium-term prospects. Time: 1 hour ago

item.title: Jyoti CNC Automation Ltd Upgraded to Hold Amid Mixed Financial and Technical Signals
item.description: Jyoti CNC Automation Ltd has seen its investment rating upgraded from Sell to Hold as of 30 December 2025, reflecting a notable improvement in technical indicators alongside steady fundamental performance. The upgrade comes amid a mixed financial backdrop but is underpinned by enhanced market sentiment and robust management efficiency. Time: 1 hour ago

item.title: India Shelter Finance Corporation Ltd Upgraded to Hold on Attractive Valuation and Strong Financials
item.description: India Shelter Finance Corporation Ltd has seen its investment rating upgraded from Sell to Hold, driven primarily by an improved valuation profile and sustained financial performance. The housing finance company’s recent quarterly results, alongside its relative valuation metrics and technical indicators, have collectively contributed to this reassessment by analysts as of 30 December 2025. item.title: Sai Silks (Kalamandir) Ltd Downgraded to Sell Amid Technical Weakness and Growth Concerns

item.title: Senco Gold Ltd Upgraded to Hold by MarketsMOJO Amid Mixed Fundamentals and Technical Signals
item.description: Senco Gold Ltd has seen its investment rating upgraded from Sell to Hold as of 30 December 2025, reflecting a nuanced shift in its technical outlook and valuation metrics despite ongoing challenges in financial performance and market returns. This article analyses the four key parameters driving this change: Quality, Valuation, Financial Trend, and Technicals, providing investors with a comprehensive understanding of the company’s current standing within the Gems, Jewellery and Watches sector. item.title: NMDC Steel Ltd Upgraded to Sell on Technical Improvements Despite Lingering Fundamental Concerns
item.description: NMDC Steel Ltd has seen its investment rating upgraded from Strong Sell to Sell as of 30 Dec 2025, driven primarily by a shift in technical indicators despite ongoing fundamental challenges.
